Ingredients.6: 1 (32 ounce) container chicken broth, or more as needed

Ingredients.7: 1 (28 ounce) can crushed San Marzano tomatoes

Ingredients.9: 1 pinch freshly ground black pepper, or to taste

Ingredients.10: 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste

Ingredients.12: 1 teaspoon white sugar, or to taste

Ingredients.14: 1 salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.16: 2 tablespoons thinly sliced fresh basil leaves, divided

Directions.1: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat; cook and stir onion and celery with a pinch of salt until onion is translucent, 5 to 8 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.

Directions.2: Pour chicken broth and tomatoes into onion mixture. Bring to a simmer and season with paprika, black pepper, and cayenne pepper. Turn heat to low and stir rice into soup; skim foam occasionally and simmer until rice and vegetables are very tender, 35 to 45 minutes. Add sugar.

Directions.3: Blend soup with an immersion blender in the pot until smooth. Whisk 1/2 cup cream into soup and season with salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, and sugar if needed. If soup is too thick, add more broth; if soup is too thin, cook, stirring often, until reduced and slightly thickened, about 10 minutes.

Directions.4: Ladle into warmed bowls; garnish each bowl with a drizzle of cream and top each with about 1 teaspoon chopped basil.
